nodes.bodyText: some log would be nice that we would like stop the which db instance
some log would be nice that we would like start the which db instance

I think we should check first that do we really need to start the initiate start action or not.
When one of the CB node dies and trying to restart the flow we dont want to initiate the start event twice

I think we should check first that do we really need to start the initiate stop action or not.
When one of the CB node dies and trying to restart the flow we dont want to initiate the stop event twice
It might be superfluous to query databaseServerConfig. I think if you just query DBStack and check its status if it is in delete_in_progress.

AbstractRedbeamsStartAction and AbstractRedbeamsStopAction are very similar, are almost the same. Also, they are quite similar to AbstractRedbeamsProvisionAction and TerminationAction. I would try to create one common class from them, AbstractRedbeamsAction and use it in all four flows.
If that is too big of a task (~more than an 1-2 hours of work), then I would create a separate refactor jira for it.
